document.docTitle: Dendropaemon (Coprophanaeoides) pilosissimus Genier & Arnaud, new species
document.masterDocTitle: Dendropaemon Perty, 1830: taxonomy, systematics and phylogeny of the morphologically most derived phanaeine genus (Coleoptera: Scarabaeidae, Scarabaeinae, Phanaeini)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Dendropaemon Perty, 1830: taxonomy, systematics and phylogeny of the morphologically most derived phanaeine genus (Coleoptera: Scarabaeidae, Scarabaeinae, Phanaeini)

heading.emphasis:
9 .
Dendropaemon (Coprophanaeoides) pilosissimus Génier & Arnaud
, new species

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type locality
. Parque Nacional Cerro Corá, Departamento Amambay, Paraguay .

Diagnosis. The three-segmented meso- and metatarsi combined with the acutely notched external side of each clypeal tooth will place this species in
Coprophanaeoides
. Within
Coprophanaeoides
, the completely and rather uniformly setose interstriae 8 will separate it from all other species.

Primary type data
. Holotype female ( FSCA ): [ PARAGUAY : Dpto./ Amambay:/ P.N. Cero Corá/
12– 16 .x. 1981
/ Colr. J.Kochalka]; [ WORLD / SCARAB./ DATABASE/ WSD00016763]; [ HOLOTYPE ♀/ Dendropaemon / pilosissimus / Génier & Arnaud, 2014 ] red card.

Etymology .
Pilosissimus
, an adjective derived from pilosus (hairy) combined with the magnifier “-issimus” relating to the extreme pilosity of this species.
